text: if my top software company in Europe we
deliver sauce pastes financial and
accounting and other types of software
to a million customers across Europe we
had several challenges related to our
use of private clouds one of them was
that development and operations worked
very inefficiently we were only able to
update our cloud solutions about six
times a year you know we migrated from
the from the database we market for
Microsoft is equal to an open-source
pastes database service and we cut the
cost in half we have now configured
automated scaling on the AWS platform
which means that we scale up when these
systems are used more by customers and
so they get increased performance and we
scale down when the systems are not as
heavily used and then we don't have to
pay for resources that are not needed
one of the most important capabilities
that we put out of the AWS platform was
self-service because of all the
automation possibilities that the AWS
platform has given us we are able to
automate many parts of our development
process which means that we are able to
deploy changes to production more
frequently than we were able to do
before
after migrating to AWS and implementing
continuous delivery on DevOps
we now update our cloud services about
six times a month
on average one example of a service we
built on AWS is a route optimisation
service to health care workers in Norway
when they visit patients at home that
needs care they can calculate their
driving route through this application
this means that the health care workers
can spend less time in traffic and more
time at home with these patients using
affirmation are able to define our
entire infrastructure as code which has
many benefits we are now able to have
our infrastructure under version control
this means we can do code reviews of our
infrastructure changes just as we do for
our application changes we have many
workloads that we are aiming to
modernize by moving to AWS we want to
improve reliability performance and
